alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 7:02PM CST until March 08 at 7:05AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, State Highway 216 affected. Extensive acreage near Harris Brake Lake and the Wildlife Management Area are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue falling to 21.8 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 29.0 Sun 6 PM 26.4 23.0 22.6 **FALLING** &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
